title: ‘Sri Lanka Meltdown’ on Channel News Asia tonight
body_lines: A special documentary on Sri Lanka’s current crisis will be aired on Channel News Asia today (26 May at 9:30 p.m. Singapore time (7 p.m. Sri Lanka time).

Produced by internationally acclaimed real life story producer Tamal Mukharjee, ‘Sri Lanka Meltdown’ will present the country’s fall precipitated by poor political decisions.  It is based on real life case studies hence will unfold an unbiased story. Prime Minister Ranil Wickramasinghe will also share his views during the show.
The award-winning producer Mukharjee is world known for his research-based story telling.
CNA’s insider is a well-known series of documentaries that probes into issues faced by people and nations and has a wide global following.
Field production and research in Sri Lanka has been carried out by Mahesh Senanayake under the supervision of Tamal Mukharjee. https://youtube.com/user/channelnewsasia
